import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Remove asset owner"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/assets/{assetId}/remove-owner"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Clears ownership from an asset, making it unassigned. Use this when reclaiming a device, preparing it for reassignment, or removing a stale assignment after a return.

**Prerequisites**
1. **assetId** - Locate the asset via [POST /api/v1.0/assets](/docs/api/assets/search-assets) or [GET /api/v1.0/assets/\{assetId\}](/docs/api/assets/get-asset-by-id).

**Workflow Example**
1. Confirm the asset record and current owner.
2. [POST /api/v1.0/assets/\{assetId\}/remove-owner](/docs/api/assets/remove-asset-owner) to clear the ownership link.
3. Optionally set `force=true` to bypass read-only and ownership checks.

**Minimal Required Fields**: `assetId` (path).

**Alternative Path**: `/api/v1.0/assets/{assetId}/remove-owner/{force}` where `force` is a boolean path parameter.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"assetId","in":"path","required":true,"description":"UUID of the asset","schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}},{"name":"force","in":"query","required":false,"description":"When true, bypasses ownership checks and read-only asset restrictions. Default is false.","schema":{"type":"boolean","default":false}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
